intro: Ricinocarpus rottleroides, commonly known as the Indian star anise, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, star-shaped fruits that resemble anise. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers and has compound leaves with serrated edges. Its fruits are used in traditional medicine and as a spice due to their strong aroma and medicinal properties. The plant thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forested areas.
